title: I'm seriously getting pissed off with Katarina
body:
Coming from a former Katarina main, something needs to be done about this champ. Yes I am making this post cause I just lost a game to a Katarina, but how it happened is beyond my fkin knowledge as to why it's allowed. I was 7-1 as Kassadin, she was 1-7. She went bot, I followed her, she killed my two team mates with like 200 health in 1 second before I could do anything, now this is where I have a problem. Off those 2 kills she got Zhonya's, and then she just snowballed out of control. You couldn't focus her cause she has statis and it's so easy to negate focus with statis. Then once she picked up a few more kills she got ludens, dcap etc. So my question is although she is an assassin, why is her scaling so poorly tuned? 

I don't care about her q, w, or e scaling. I'm talking about R with the 750 base damage 250% AP ratio and 375% bonus AD ratio. Who at riot thought it would be a good idea to give an AOE spell that much base damage and scaling? Let's look at Kassadin's old scaling for example. His Q did 220 + 0.7 AP, E did 280 + 0.7 AP , and R did like 120 + 80%. I have no problem with this as it is mostly single target damage except for E, yeah he's a mobile assassin and he's very slippery and such, but so is Katarina, and I'll tell you why, Kassadin will usually go in kill someone then get out cause he has Riftwalk, well with Katarina's passive she can technically use Shunpo 5 times in a short window when you're teamfighting, assuming you hit everyone. 

It has 700 range, (old kassa range), Does damage, and gives damage reduction. All of this scaling and utility on an assassin is obviously not healthy as Riot is trying to prove with Kassadin, so why does someone like Katarina get all of old Kassadin's scaling in 1 ability? Sure you're able to CC it, but what aren't you able to CC in this game except unstopable force, and assult and battery, a few others too that I can't think of ATM. Anyways my point is that Katarina's ult scaling needs to be toned down, it use to be 150%AP, god knows why they brought it up to 250% when she was already melting people pre nerf.

P.S., you can say CC her all you want, it won't matter since it's solo queue and everyone wastes their CC at the beginning of the teamfight, and there i am the idiot who saved his Null Sphere to silence her ult, but nope I can't even target the fker cause she jumps somewhere new every 2 seconds, and I end up accidentally targeting it on someone else, god forbid she also has zhonya's and avoids all your damage all together. 

TL;DR Yes I'm mad that I lost to a trash Kat, you can say well " she beat you so obv she isn't trash", trust me the way she was playing all game was trash. Fact of the matter is all you have to do in a teamfight as Kat is stand behind the team hiding, wait for the enemy team to waste CC, shunpo in the press R, THAT'S IT. No positioning required, no thinking, just braindead button pressing. Her scaling needs adjustments. Base health reductions won't fix any problems and she does too much damage and her staying alive isn't the problem.

replies.body: You realize kass' Q negates her ult, right? If you followed her like you said, how did she get a double

If they have 200 health like OP said, **no one** needs to ult them; they were pretty much already dead.  Most any champ could get a double kill off that; it was bot lane's fault for sticking around with no health or wards.
That's still bullshit when someone who was 1-7 suddenly destroys everyone out of 2 kills
Even if you are 1- 7, 200 damage is not that impossible to deal
To be fair, he didn't say she shouldn't be able to. He was saying a 3-7 champ shouldn't be able to dominate.
if you are fed against some one its common that the oppoent goes else where to catch up and come back

Problem with Kat is:
Riot keeps on removing any tools to fight against her.
Targeted CC? Like only few left.
Insta CC? Nope

And all other CC that you could use against her is:
a) easy to miss / easy to dodge
b) slow projectile/takes some insane 5 minute animation (obvious exaggeration).

And on top of that her combo doesn't require animations. Which means she can insta kill someone in split second.
You should be CCing her when she's ultling, at that point she's a sitting duck. Most supports have at least 1 ability they can easily hold off for her.

Most people don't seem to realize her QEW also deals tons of damage and should be enough to jump on a weakened squishy who already got some damage in a teamfight, then she got her reset and the whole enemy team is fucked. People who say such things probably played against extremely awful Katarinas who engage a teamfight or something. You also have to use CC to peel away their jungler, toplaner plus the CC of many champs are part of their combo to deal damage. If i play Katarina or any champion who is screwed by CC i also just take QSS, you can even upgrade it to Merc Scimitar because she also has AD scalings........

You have champs that have reset gimmicks (Kha Trist Akali etc) which work fineish because only 1 ability gets reset. When the champion's full gimmick is: "I kill people for resets to kill more people"? No. Like seriously how the hell do you balance that, it's a stupid passive.

What irks me is that this is so obvious, yet there is no sense that people understand it. It doesn't matter what your scaling or base damage is, if you get to spam every ability 5 times, you're going to do a lot of damage. And there is no way to balance it because what situation are you balancing for? No resets is obviously a terrible balance point, but if you balance for 2 resets for example, then your laning sucks etc. Terrible design in every way.

What pisses me off about her is her targeted, no cost, low cooldown Q. Doesn't feel too good middle when you toss your Q out as whatever champion you are, for it to either miss or for her to shunpo out of it's path and just toss a Q at you. Not to mention you can stay out of it's initial cast range and it'll bounce to you from minions regardless.
He had Kass, complaining about point and click Q sounds funny.

If you're referring to how Kass and Kat both have point and click Q's then there is a difference. When I see Kassadin throw his Q I can also see his mana bar deplete, however little it may be doesn't matter, at least it's going down. Katarina, on the other hand, can toss it whenever it's up with the only repercussion being that it pushes the wave. Not to mention that Kass's can only hit one target, whereas Katarina's can hit multiple.

> I'm talking about R with the 750 base damage 250% AP ratio and 375% bonus AD ratio. Who at riot thought it would be a good idea to give an AOE spell that much base damage and scaling?

Incidentally, Fiddlesticks's ult does more. And hits more people. And he can use Zhonya's in the middle of it. Also, 750 base is pretty damn fine considering it takes her 2.5 seconds to do it. If there is a problem with Kat, this isn't it.

Considering Fiddle ults cooldown is 130 seconds at max rank, compared to Katarina's ult at 45 seconds which can get COMPLETELY reset with 3 kills/assists, potentially enabling her to use it twice in one team fight, and almost a third time assuming she had 100% kill participation that fight. Fiddle is also 100 units shorter in range, but can also move during ult.

And fiddles doesn't have a 700 range blink that reduces damage he takes, and he takes mana to cast shit, and he needs to channel before cast, and... the list goes on... Bringing up fiddles in contrast to Kat is as dumb as using Singed to justify Kalista.

Fiddle can keep you in his ultimate, cast spells during the use, use it to teleport, and move/be-cc'd. Kat has to stand still for a long time. If you get hit by Kat's full combo, and you can't do something- you either played improperly or it was blind pick. No offense, it's how it is. If you know she can 100-0 you, you save a spell(s) to negate her kill potential. If it was blind pick, and you got nada- welp, you got nada. I would personally take Fiddle's ulti over Kat's any day of any week.
And then because of animation cancelling she can burst you down faster than you can CC her in a 1v1 with Q E W R, if your CC has a cast time.

Kat doesn't cancel, Riven does. Kat only got her animations smoothed out, they aren't cancellable. She cannot beat a fiddlesticks in a 1v1. That's a wet dream.
